comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content: Does it seem likely to anyone else that the armoured vehicle on the left is the same "Fighting 2nd" Whippet posted before? (The visible registration is compatible and the "double rear wheel" set-up, turret and rear platform look like that of the Whippets'...)

comment.author: 64478079@N02
comment._content: Such an interesting piece of history captured.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/20727502@N00] Absolutely, Eagle Eye!! I was being sneaky, waiting to see if anyone'd spot it... Got so excited when I noticed it, because it's one thing to see the type of posed shot when we first met The Fighting 2nd / ARR 3, but to see it in action is something else!

comment.author: 32149975@N07
comment._content:
They don't look terribly nervous!

When the 1916 rising, my mother's aunt cycled from Dublin to Athboy to escape!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sarahkmc] I think people may have been made of sterner stuff back in the day! When did your mother's aunt come back?
